question: Couscous, the staple food of which region, has been included in the UNESCO Cultural Heritage List?
explanation:
The staple food of the North African region, Couscous has been included in the UNESCO list of the worldâ€™s intangible cultural heritage.
The rival countries Algeria and Morocco along with Tunisia and Mauritania had submitted the petition to add the dish in the UNESCO list, in March 2019. Couscous is also known as Seksu, Kusksi and Kseksu, in the North African region.
